notesStmt.note: All folios partially water-damaged. The last quire is imperfect, with a lacuna after folio 140 and 148. Water-damaged. The 15th quire is now imperfect, with a lacuna after folio 194 and 202.
Folios 208r-209v: two appended folios, mutilated, written in two different Sefardi hands, of apparently 11 to 12th century, containing fragments of Talmud (Mo῾ed Katan and Eruvin).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two fragments of Judeo-Arabic commentary of Yefet ben 'Eli on Exodus.

collation.p:
15 quires (6-20), of mostly 10 leaves each.
Quires signed with Hebrew letters on the righ-hand upper corner of the first page.
8 quires (9-16) of unequal length.
Quires signed with Hebrew letters on the right-hand upper corner of the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Semi-cursive script of 15-16th century. Semi-cursive script of 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Yefet. Commentary on Exodus. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2468.'

history.provenance: Mosheh ben Yosef ben Yeshu῾ah ben Avraham ha-Melamed

Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [208v].
